name: Michael Everett
content: Michael Everett - Khoury College of Computer Sciences All People Michael Everett Assistant Professor, Jointly Appointed with College of Engineering Research interests Research interests Robotics Motion planning Reinforcement learning Neural network verification Control theory Education Education PhD in Mechanical Engineering, Massachusetts Institute of Technology MS in Mechanical Engineering, Massachusetts Institute of Technology BS in Mechanical Engineering, Massachusetts Institute of Technology Biography Biography Michael Everett is an assistant professor in the Khoury College of Computer Sciences and the College of Engineering at Northeastern University, based in Boston. Everett focuses on the intersection of robotics, deep learning, and control theory, with the aim of developing certifiable learning machines in which robots can safely, reliably, and efficiently perform tasks. Some specific techniques of interest are reinforcement learning, model predictive control, and navigation in challenging environments. Everett works as a visiting faculty researcher with Google’s People + AI Research team. Previously, he was a research scientist and postdoctoral associate at the MIT Department of Aeronautics and Astronautics. Outside of the lab, Everett enjoys scuba diving and playing frisbee with his dog, Holly.
